Expectation1: Follow safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries on site
Situation1: Before starting structural work, the carpenter needs to inspect and maintain tools and equipment to ensure safety and efficiency
Expectation2: Recite and reflect on the Quran
Situation2: The community study circle convenes tonight to discuss verses the person has not yet read.
Story: I stood in the workshop, the scent of sawdust thick in the air, my hands running over the cold metal of my tools. Tomorrow, we’d start the structural work on the new house, and I knew the safety protocols by heart: every tool must be checked, every blade sharpened, every cord untangled. My crew depended on me to make sure nothing was overlooked. But as I glanced at the clock, my heart tightened. Tonight was the community Quran study circle, and I hadn’t read the assigned verses. I could already imagine the gentle disappointment in my imam’s eyes, the expectation that I would come prepared, ready to reflect and share. My mind raced between the responsibility to my team’s safety and my commitment to my faith. The tools lay before me, waiting for inspection, while my Quran sat unopened in my bag. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in, each demanding my time, each unwilling to wait.
